intro: Telanthera rufa var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth red telanthera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color. The plant has smooth, glabrous stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
